result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek Michael Ball DOC #00369902 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Derek Michael Ball DOC #00369902 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Derek Michael Ball DOC #00369902 was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Derek Michael Ball DOC #00369902 was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Derek Michael Ball DOC #00369902 was found guilty of Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).
  • Derek Michael Ball DOC #00369902 was found guilty of Attempt Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.203(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

1:05 PM 
Defendant Derek Michael Ball appeared by video form the Iowa County Jail.  Victim Robert L Ball appeared by video.  Attorney Steven W. Zaleski appeared by video for Derek Michael Ball.  Attorney Jenna L Gill appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to in person appearance for purposes of plea and sentencing today.
Attorney Zaleski Informs the court this matter is resolved and informs the court the files plea questionnaire and waiver of rights has been filed.
Defendant enters plea of "GUILTY" - Counts 1, 3, 7 & 8 .
Court questions defendant re: his plea and waiver of rights.
Parties stipulate to a factual basis.
State waives right to jury trial.
Court questions attorney Zaleski re: his clients plea and waiver of rights.
Defendant is advised of their voting rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, voluntarily, and intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY". 

State moves to dismiss the remaining counts.
So ordered.

State moves for joint recommendation of the parties.
Attorney Zaleski joins in the motion and makes statement on behalf of his client.

Court Orders:
**Count 1 - 90 Day's County Jail
-Costs
-AODA

**Count 3 - 9 Months County Jail
-Costs
-AODA

**Count 7 - 2 Years Initial followed by 2 Years ES
-Costs

**Count 8 - 2 Years Initial followed by 2 Years ES - ALL CONCURRENT TO EACH OTHER
-Costs
